RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY 


Commitment to the Community

BASF Corporation has a long tradition of operating its facilities in the safest possible manner.  BASF also believes in being a responsible corporate citizen and maintaining open, constructive dialogue with our neighbors.  These principles are an integral part of our corporate vision statement and values.  We believe that sharing this information with our neighbors makes good sense.  By doing so, we believe the community will better understand how safe and ecologically sound BASF operations are.


Policies

BASF Corporation has the following Corporate Guidelines related to environmental, health and safety:

7 We produce products that are safe to manufacture, use and dispose of.
7 We assist our customers to use our products safely and in an environmentally sound manner.  We
  provide them with information on correct handling of our products.
7 We minimize the impact on mankind and the environment during production, storage, transportation, 
  marketing and use of our products.
7 Economic considerations do not take priority over environmental protection, health and safety.
7 An important contribution to "Sustainable Development" is our involvement in the "Responsible Care" 
  initiative worldwide.  This applies to our products and services in all our businesses and affiliates.
7 We are committed to making continuous improvements in safety, health and environmental protection.  We 
  do this acting on our own initiative and in consultation with recognized regulatory authorities.  We take 
  any action judged to be necessary, whether or not dictated by statutory obligation or official regulations.
7 We encourage safety, environmental and health awareness among employees.
7 We regard it as an important corporate duty to advance science and technology in order to improve 
  safety and environmental protection.
7 We carefully weigh the potential benefits and risks of new discoveries and technologies in

dialogue with 
  scientists and society before deciding on how to proceed.
7 We pursue an open dialogue with all relevant opinion leaders in society.  Our goals are to promote and 
  strengthen mutual understanding and deepen trust in what we do.

The BASF Corporation Chattanooga Site 1 implements these policies through site-specific programs and procedures.


Facility Description

The BASF Corporation Chattanooga Site 1 uses 1,3 Butadiene and Anhydrous Ammonia. Ammonia is used for cooling purposes only. 1,3 Butadiene is used to manufacture a water based emulsion polymer or dispersion. This dispersion is used in a variety of products including foams for pillows and mattresses, shoe inserts, general purpose adhesives and for asphalt modification to improve resiliency and extend the service life of streets and highways. 


Release Scenarios

Worst Case

7 The toxic gas release of anhydrous ammonia with off-site impacts. 
7 Vapor cloud explosion resulting from the release of 1,3 butadiene with off-site impacts. Administrative 
   procedures limit the 1,3 butadiene storage capacity.   

Alternative

7 The pipe leak of anhydrous ammonia with off-site impacts. 
7 Jet fire resulting from the release of 1,3 butadiene with off-site impacts.  


Accidental Release Prevention Program

To prevent accidental releases, this facility is in compliance with the EPA Risk Management Program, the OSHA Process Safety Management standard, and the Chemical Manufacturer Association's Responsible Care Process Safety Code. 


Five Year Accident History

This facility has had no accidental release(s) over the past five years, which meet the reporting criteria.


Emergency Response Program

This facility has an emergency response plan that is coordinated with the community plan.  Hazmat team members are trained and participate in drills regularly.


Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Facility processes are routinely changed to improve safety as a result of employee suggestions, process hazard

analyses, incident investigations, etc.

For example, some changes that will be initiated prior to the end of 1999 will improve the safety of our regulated processes and include:

7 Construction of an automatic and/or remotely actuated deluge sprinkler system over the entire reactor 
  area. 
7 Construction of an automatic and/or remotely actuated deluge system to protect and provide vapor 
  suppression for the ammonia receiver and pumps.
7 Installation of remotely actuated isolation valves for the ammonia receiver and distribution piping. 
7 Installation of a remote method of monitoring the ammonia refrigeration compressor operation.
7 Installation of remotely actuated isolation valves for all of the 1,3 butadiene storage tanks. 
7 Installation of remotely actuated isolation valves for the 1,3 butadiene unloading station.
7 Installation of density meters on the drains of 1,3 butadiene storage vessels to prevent any emissions 
  during the routine draining of water from vessels.
